title: Why Manchester United's Old Trafford stronghold is Jurgen Klopp's final frontier
text:
“This team wrote their own story and this would be another step. But we cannot make it by simply talking about it. We have to go there and play the best football we can.

“If we can, then we are really an uncomfortable opponent.

“We are getting closer and closer and closer since I have been here, but still it did not happen.

“When I first came here and went to Old Trafford it was really difficult. Nobody expected us to win - perhaps not lose too high or maybe get a point.

“Now the situation has changed. We expect – whoever we are up against or wherever we go – a chance to win the game.

“To guarantee to win a game you have to be in it to a point where if a situation develops and there is a winner, it is going to be us. That is what we will try to do. It has nothing to do with history.”
description: For Liverpool and Jurgen Klopp, victory at Old Trafford on Sunday afternoon represents the final frontier in the Premier League.
